RESEARCH

The Glasgow School of Art has a distinctive specialist, practice-based research culture which is widely recognised internationally. The generation of new knowledge and understanding through creative practice, scholarship and criticism in Fine Art, Design, Craft, Architecture and related fields is central to the concept of research. Our researchers include artists, designers, architects, historians and critics of world standing.

The School of Design offers opportunities for part-time and full-time programmes of research and welcome applications for either mode. The following is an outline indication of the topics in which we are interested in receiving proposals for research programmes. This is not a definitive list of our specialist interests and it does not include those current projects in which there are at present no opportunities for additional students. Enquiries about the following and other topics will be considered on their merits and on our capacity to provide appropriate expert supervision.

  • Drawing - as a tool for thinking about the design process
  • Digital Design - especially in the area of textiles
  • Inclusive Design - particularly in relation to an inclusive approach for the independent elderly and disabled
  • Materials and Processes Technology - especially in the area of Ceramics and Silversmithing & Jewellery
  • Design History - especially using the Glasgow School of Art Archive, eg the Robert Stewart Exhibition.
  • Design Education
